title: Blue Origin and SpaceX start work on cargo versions of crewed lunar landers
summary: The two companies with NASA contracts to develop crewed lunar landers are also beginning work on cargo versions of their spacecraft.

title: Euclid Avionics Model Arrives at ESA ESOC in Germany
summary:
The avionics model of the European Space Agency’s Euclid space telescope has arrived at the agency’s European Space Operations Centre (ESOC) in Darmstadt, Germany. Euclid was launched aboard a Falcon 9 in July 2023 and is currently stationed about 1.5 million kilometres away from Earth at Lagrange Point 2. The telescope was designed to explore […]
The post Euclid Avionics Model Arrives at ESA ESOC in Germany appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Guetlein calls for a change in culture in ‘responsive space’
summary: If a U.S. satellite gets taken out by an adversary, the default response cannot just be to speedily launch a replacement, Guetlein said at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

title: Re-Entry Seals Peregrine’s Fate
summary: Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander re-entered the Earth’s atmosphere on January 18th, 2024, ending its mission after a 10 day, tumultuous journey through cislunar space. While its launch was fully successful, riding atop the first United Launch Alliance Vulcan rocket, the lander encountered a series of anomalies during its checkout phase which ultimately precluded a lunar landing. The mission came to an end on January 18th when the spacecraft re-entered the Earth’s atmosphere, ensuring safe disposal and minimizing cislunar debris.
